result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashton M. Curtin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling as recommended.

AODA and follow up.

DNA sample.

Defendant eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

Case Called: 10:14 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jessica Phelps in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
File an Amended Complaint.
Amend Count 1 to Count 1 (Possession of THC-PTAC).
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC-PTAC)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-PTAC)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC-PTAC)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 3 Days Credit.

Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-PTAC)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 3 Days Credit.

Court Orders that the Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

Adjourned: 10:25 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2022 at 10:20 am.

Case called: 9:36 a.m.
Clerk: Heather.      
Defendant appears in person, pro se.

COURT questions defendant regarding if he has been to SPD yet.
Defendant indicates he was under the impression he qualifies but he has not heard anything yet.
(OTR: 9:37 a.m. - BOTR: 9:47 a.m.)
COURT ORDERS defendant to go to SPD office right now and come back to notify COURT of the results of his visit.
OTR: 9:50 a.m. - BOTR - 9:54 a.m.)
Defendant indicates he called SPD and was informed he is inelligible due to his financial situation.
COURT finds Defendant indigent and appoints Atty Jessica Pehlps at the rate of $100.00 per hour; MAX $600.00 without further court order.
WAGE ASSIGNMENT: $100.00 per month.
Defendant has previously waived time limits.
